title: 113_hr3566
content: The Act may be cited as the "Domestic Violence Criminal Disarmament Act of 2013" and includes a grant program regarding firearms. Section 506(b) of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to specify the purposes for which grants can be provided to States or local governments. Section 506(b) of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to allow grants to States that have adopted firearm and ammunition possession laws similar to federal regulations. The restrictions in paragraph (1) apply to individuals who possess firearms that may be used to threaten, harass, or harm the victim or their child, or pose a danger to them. It also considers individuals subject to other protection orders regarding firearm possession. The text chunk discusses the seizure or surrender of firearms and ammunition from individuals who possess firearms that may threaten, harass, or harm the victim, or pose a danger to them. It aims to ensure that state or local law enforcement carry out the seizure or surrender as authorized. The text chunk authorizes the seizure or surrender of firearms and ammunition from individuals subject to protection orders or charged with a crime, to protect victims. It also ensures the safe return of the firearms and ammunition. State and local law enforcement can seize firearms and ammunition in domestic violence situations if there is probable cause to believe they are a threat to the victim.
